intro: Ceropegia sprengeri subsp. commutata, commonly known as the string of hearts, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia sprengeri subsp. commutata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
